image.altText: a woman wearing a suit looks sideways

props.synopsis: The former premier has failed to overturn a finding of serious corrupt conduct after challenging a report by the corruption watchdog in the state's highest civil court.

title.children: 'I always worked my hardest': Berejiklian fails to overturn ICAC corruption findings

image.altText: US Senator Kamala Harris smiles widely as she walks ahead of three other people.

props.synopsis: As Joe Biden starts his long goodbye with a televised address from the Oval Office, Donald Trump and his likely rival in November's presidential election, Kamala Harris, have been trading blows, as a recast race for the White House begins.

title.children: As Biden pledges to 'pass the torch', his VP is sharpening her attacks on Trump

image.altText: Strobe lights surround an illuminated Eiffel Tower at night

props.synopsis: The opening ceremony for the 2024 Olympic Games, held almost entirely along Paris's River Seine, promises to be the most spectacular ever attempted — but it brings with it many complications and immeasurable risk.

title.children: Inside the Paris opening ceremony — the most spectacular and riskiest ever attempted

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu and Kamala Harris shake hands in front of US and Israel flags.

props.synopsis: The US vice-president has met with Israel's prime minister in what she describes as "frank" talks on the humanitarian crisis in Gaza.

title.children: 'I will not be silent': Harris presses Netanyahu over humanitarian situation in Gaza

image.altText: A soccer player wearing white and black holds her arms in the air while another player in yellow looks sad behind her

props.synopsis: Twenty-four years ago, the Matildas lost to Germany 3-0 in their opening Olympics group game. Will history continue to repeat itself in Paris?

title.children: Matildas haunted by history in Olympic loss to Germany

image.altText: A man wearing a blue Australian aviation uniform standing in front of a military plane.

props.synopsis: Aviation drills for Exercise Pitch Black have resumed today after an aircraft crashed in a remote part of the NT during the multinational military exercise on Wednesday.

title.children: Major military exercise resumes in the NT after Italian jet crash

image.altText: Witold Banka

props.synopsis: As Paris gets ready for its glittering opening ceremony, an anti-doping feud between sporting heavyweights is creating tension in backrooms and press conferences.

title.children: An Olympic-sized fight has erupted among anti-doping officials, and it's just getting started

image.altText: A sinking oil tanker.

props.synopsis: Efforts are underway to clean up an oil spill that could reach the Philippines capital following the sinking of a tanker in rough seas.

title.children: Typhoon Gaemi hits China after sinking ships and causing an oil spill that threatens Philippines capital

image.altText: Older woman with grey hair holding a colourful hand knitted doll.

props.synopsis: Carolyn Crawford's addiction to the pokies was so bad she used to hear their bells while lying in bed at night. She says the only way to save chronic gamblers from jail is through a system of "gambling courts".

title.children: She'd never even had a parking fine, but Carolyn's pokies addiction landed her in jail at 64

image.altText: A group of people holding signs and wearing tshirts saying Don't Torch Journalism.

props.synopsis: Journalists at Nine newspapers have begun a five-day strike after rejecting a pay offer from management ahead of the Paris Olympics opening ceremony.

title.children: Journalists from Nine newspapers begin five-day strike

image.altText: Drone shot of the farm at Yirrkala.

props.synopsis: It's been a long time since people in this remote corner of Australia have been able to buy locally grown fruit and veggies. A new farm has changed that.

title.children: Why fruit and veg sales are soaring in this remote community

image.altText: Leanne Liddle, Ned Hargraves and Mary Williams composite image.

props.synopsis: Amid the violence in Alice Springs that's contributed to two curfews there have been conversations around the role of "payback". But some Indigenous leaders say payback has nothing to do with the recent fighting.

title.children: Violence in Alice Springs not the result of cultural 'payback', Indigenous leaders say

image.altText: Rohan Taylor speaks at a media conference ahead of the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Swimming Australia head coach Rohan Taylor says coach Michael Palfrey will face "consequences" for his inflammatory comments when the Paris Games finish.

title.children: 'Un-Australian' swimming coach to face consequences over Korea comments, but only after Paris Olympics

image.altText: An old photograph and sketch of a man in a photo collage

props.synopsis: Mexican drug lord Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada and the son of his former partner, Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman, were arrested in Texas.

title.children: Mexican drug lord 'El Mayo' and El Chapo's son arrested in Texas

image.altText: A North Korean flag sits behind lines of lime green code on a black background

props.synopsis: The United States, South Korea and United Kingdom say the campaign shows how dangerous North Korea is as it tries to support its nuclear ambitions.

title.children: NASA and US military bases hit by North Korean cyber criminals, US and allies say

image.altText: a small white modular home

props.synopsis: Young adults are increasingly drawing on the "bank of mum and dad" no matter what their parents' income and for far more than a housing deposit, researchers have found.

title.children: How far would you go to help an adult child get a home? This woman moved into a flat in her backyard

image.altText: An illustration of a very tall man with an 18th century tricorne hat on. Other people come up to his elbows in height

props.synopsis: Known as the Irish Giant, Charles Byrne's dying wish was to be buried at sea to avoid being dissected and displayed after he died. But he was betrayed and centuries later the debate over where his remains should rest continues.

title.children: The 'Irish Giant' was petrified of becoming a surgeon's plaything. A betrayal saw his worst fears come true

image.altText: Monkeypox view under the microscope

props.synopsis: Australia is experiencing a resurgence of mpox, prompting alerts from state health departments as clusters of the virus continue to grow.

title.children: Calls to limit sexual partners as mpox makes a resurgence in Australia

image.altText: A compilation of images showing an Australian flag, Kamala Harris, Joe Biden and an F1 driver celebrating

props.synopsis: It's time to test your knowledge about the news of the week.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Cocaine sharks, an 'un-Australian' swimming coach and an AI video of Steven Miles

image.altText: a towering building is covered in futuristic red panels and laced with large silver exterior pipes

props.synopsis: The "cloud" that powers everything from sending an email to asking an AI chatbot a question needs massive amounts of power to run, and that's making energy experts nervous.

title.children: Power-hungry data centres scrambling to find enough electricity to meet demand

image.altText: Sathyan Ilanko crouching with one hand on his hip, the other on his hat, wearing sunglasses and all black

props.synopsis: It's still sinking in for Western Sydney musician Sathyan Ilanko that the first song he's ever written for another artist has been streamed more than 70 million times, and counting.

title.children: Tamil love song Aasa Kooda catapults Australian talent to global fame

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Ahead of the June quarter inflation figure out on Wednesday, the collective holding of breath is palpable. That number, and its consequences, could affect the government's political fortunes for months.

title.children: Behind the scenes, something is preoccupying the government — and it's not the cabinet reshuffle

image.altText: Women, children and men gather in a village under a palm tree in Papua New Guinea

props.synopsis: Violent attacks on three remote villages in Papua New Guinea's north has reportedly killed 26 people, including 16 children, while several people were forced to flee after attackers set fire to their homes, the United Nations said.

title.children: People beheaded, a village burned amid brutal violence in PNG province

image.altText: A family portrait of Benn Lockyer on a picnic rug with his wife and children, holding a picture of baby James..

props.synopsis: After Benn's newborn son died, people didn’t know how to respond. But when grief is under acknowledged, it can be harmful and isolating, psychologists say.

title.children: The question can be 'hugely triggering' for those who have lost a child

image.altText: The artist wears a grey jumper covered in paint, and has save brown and grey hair. He stands smiling in AGNSW next to paintings

props.synopsis: After decades of being locked out of the art world, Thom Roberts feels "happy and beautiful" seeing his work displayed in the Archibald and Sulman prizes.

title.children: 'Just because you have a disability doesn't mean the only art you can do is therapy': Thom Roberts is a four-time Archibald finalist

image.altText: A person's hand putting a coin, that looks like a clock, into a piggy bank

props.synopsis: An emergency fund is crucial for surviving the crises of life. But almost 20 per cent of Australians wouldn't be able to cover an unexpected expense worth $3,000.

title.children: An emergency fund protects you from life's unexpected events. Here's how much you should have saved

image.altText: Adrian Romeo has a bald head, a black beard and moustache and wears a black tshirt.

props.synopsis: A 58-year-old man is charged with murder over the disappearance of Melbourne man Adrian Romeo.

title.children: Man charged with murder over disappearance of Melbourne man Adrian Romeo

image.altText: A man's hand rock climbing with a lake below.

props.synopsis: The co-conqueror of Mount Everest, Sir Edmund Hillary, described it as Australia's "only true mountain". But, with a death just this week bringing home the dangers, climbers know Tasmania's Federation Peak is not for the faint of heart.

title.children: The deadly lure of 'Australia's only true mountain', Federation Peak

image.altText: A stock market watcher stands in front of an ASX board.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 has opened higher this morning following a fickle session on Wall Street that saw the S&P 500 and Nasdaq end lower. Follow Live.

title.children: ASX 200 opens higher after tech stocks weighed on Wall Street trade overnight

image.altText: A distressed Australian women's basketballer sits on the sideline as a coach puts his hand on her shoulder.

props.synopsis: Australia's women's basketball team calls up reserve Amy Atwell after star guard Rebecca Allen is ruled out of the Paris Games with a hamstring injury.

title.children: Opals star 'shattered' after injury in final warm-up clash knocks her out of Olympics

image.altText: Antoine Dupont is hugged

props.synopsis: The Olympic Games will not officially open for another 24 hours, but the party has well and truly started in Paris at the rugby sevens thanks to Antoine Dupont's majestic brilliance.

title.children: As Australia secured its spot in the sevens semifinal, the boisterous French took aim at a pantomime villain

image.altText: The Eiffel Tower lit up at night

props.synopsis: The next fortnight will be packed with sport and pageantry. Here's how to keep up with all the latest updates.

title.children: How to stay across the Olympics on the ABC
